description: Dauphin Island, Ala., has been ravaged by multiple storms, and has received millions in federal funds to rebuild.
title: In Alabama, a Community on Shifting Sands
title_page: In Alabama, a Community on Shifting Sands - The New York Times
maintext:
Slide 1 of 14,
A great blue heron walks on the beach in Dauphin Island, Ala. The beach was once much wider, but now houses are perilously close to the surf, and many homes have already been lost. Erosion, driven by storms and sea level rise, is causing this part of Dauphin Island to migrate toward the mainland.
